paper.title: Robust strategies for quantitative investment management
paper.abstract: We show how quantile estimation combined with robust methods can be used in quantitative investment management. A portfolio manager uses a quantitative model to select securities. The objective is to outperform a benchmark portfolio, subject to risk constraints. Traditional stock selection models express expected returns as a function of factors where all parts of the return distribution are affected similarly. This is subsumed by the quantile approach in which a stock's entire return distribution is a conditional function of factors. Robust methods insure that our estimates do not depend on a small subset of the data. Regression quantile estimates then detect the potentially different impact of factors at the center and tails of the return distribution. This is illustrated in assessing a model's forecasting accuracy while controlling for return differences between economic sectors. We are thereby able to detect forecasting properties that would have been missed by a conventional analysis of the data.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用分位数估计和稳健方法进行定量投资管理，旨在通过改进的股票选择模型来超越基准投资组合的表现，同时控制风险。这直接涉及投资组合管理的核心问题，即如何选择和优化投资组合以实现特定的投资目标。
